prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism The first part of the assembly is a rectangular prism. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) that forms the perimeter of the rectangular prism. Loop\\_1 consists of four lines: - Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] - Line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.125 units in the positive Z direction. The final dimensions of the rectangular prism are 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.125 units in height. Next, we will create a cylindrical hole in the center of the rectangular prism. Part 2: A Cylindrical Hole The second part of the assembly is a cylindrical hole in the center of the rectangular prism. Coordinate System Use the same coordinate system as Part 1. Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) that forms the perimeter of the cylindrical hole. Loop\\_1 consists of one circle: - Circle: Center Point [0.375, 0.25], Radius 0.1875 Extrusion Cut the sketch by 0.125 units in the positive Z direction to create the cylindrical hole. The final dimensions of the cylindrical hole are 0.375 units in radius and 0.25 units in height, with a slightly larger diameter than the width of the rectangular prism. The final shape of the assembly is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, with the hole slightly larger than the prism's width. The prism is positioned at a 45 degree angle.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.5]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.5]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.125,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The hole is slightly larger than the prism's width. The prism is positioned at a 45 degree angle from the viewer. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.5625) with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0. Creating the 2D sketch 1. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle with the following corner points: (0, 0), (0.75, 0), (0.75, 0.375), and (0, 0.375). Extruding the 2D sketch 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Rotate the scaled 2D sketch by euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 45 degrees. 3. Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch by 0.0188 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. Finalizing the first part The final dimensions of this part should be a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0188 units. Part 2: A set of three parallel rectangles with rounded corners Construct a set of three parallel rectangles with rounded corners, evenly spaced apart. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.0225, 0.3525, 0.5625) with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 180.0. Creating the 2D sketch 1. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw three rectangles with the following corner points for each: - Rectangle 1: (0, 0), (0.03, 0), (0.03, 0.03), and (0, 0.03). - Rectangle 2: (0, 0.3), (0.03, 0.3), (0.03, 0.33), and (0, 0.33). - Rectangle 3: (0.675, 0), (0.705, 0), (0.705, 0.03), and (0.675, 0.03). 3. Add rounded corners to each rectangle at each corner with a radius of 0.0125 units. Extruding the 2D sketch 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.705. 2. Rotate the scaled 2D sketch by euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 degrees. 3. Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch by 0.5625 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. Finalizing the second part The final dimensions of this part should be a length of 0.705 units, a width of 0.705 units, and a height of 0.5625 units. Assembling the full CAD model Combine part 1 and part 2 in a Boolean operation to create the final CAD model. Perform the following steps to assemble the parts: 1. Align part 1 and part 2 so that the cylindrical hole in part 1 fits around the rod in part 2. 2. Perform a join operation between part 1 and part 2. The final CAD model will have dimensions specific to the parts created in this exercise. The general shape should resemble a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, connected by a cylindrical rod on one end. Make sure to save and document the final CAD model for reference.</description>

Do not extrude in the opposite direction of the normal. Use the scaling factor 0.2647 for the sketch. The operation is to create a new solid body. **Construct the second part - a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom:** **Create a new coordinate system:** The Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0088, 0.0, 0.0088]. **Generate the 2D sketch on face_1:** The sketch contains a single face (face_1) and one loop (loop_1). The loop has 4 lines: - line_1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], End point [0.2471, 0.0] - line_2: Start point [0.2471, 0.0], End point [0.2471, 0.7324] - line_3: Start point [0.2471, 0.7324], End point [0.0, 0.7324] - line_4: Start point [0.0, 0.7324], End point [0.0, 0.0] **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D:** Do not scale the sketch. Apply a rotation of 0.0 degrees around the X-axis, 0.0 degrees around the Y-axis, and -90.0 degrees around the Z-axis. Apply a translation vector of [0.0088, 0.0, 0.0088]. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model:** Do not extrude in the direction of the normal. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.</description>
